Mission Statement

I was assembled with one Allen key and a destiny. Kids in our neighborhood were getting only full-size news, which is emotionally overwhelming. We deliver bathtub-safe miniature journalism so every household can process civic dread in adorable dimensions.

Our board includes one loofah, two retired spice racks, and a ferociously ethical bath duck.

FAQ (Frequently Aquatic Questions)

Why are all newspapers miniature?

Full-size newspapers sink morale and plumbing. Miniature newspapers float and encourage concise corruption reporting.

Is this truly a non-profit?

Yes. Every dollar goes to supplies, stipends, and replacing one brave umbrella over Editorial.

Can I donate items instead of money?

Absolutely: tiny clothespins, archival paper, and emotional support for shelf-based leadership.

How do you maintain objectivity from a bathtub?

We separate facts from foam using a strict two-rinse protocol and a standards committee chaired by my top plank.
